page.title: 16A KIVETON CHILD'S DAY 1986
page.content: Life for a Kiveton child isn't very different from anywhere else really. At {school}we do maths, English, reading and nature work. We also have {school}dinners and we can choose what we want from fish fingers, beefburgers, salads, pizza and other dishes. In assembly we have a prayer and sing. At home I {watch} television. I have my tea. On Saturdays I go horse riding and I get there by bus. On Sundays I play out. Then on Mondays it is back to { {school.} We take assembly and register, soon it is playtime. In playtime the boys usually play football and the girls talk and eat sweets. Sometimes I go to the { {library}and get some books. We have a {park}where there are swings, slides and roundabouts. You can play tennis there and also hire out golf clubs.
